Reviews.Title: “Love the Flatiron!”
Reviews.Author: Susanm56
Reviews.Content: I first discovered The Flatiron Hotel through a deal on Living Social. Right away I loved it! The rooms - although on the small side - have amazing beds with fabulous bedding and pillows. The staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby bar just opened and they started serving Breakfast just today. I've been back 3 times and looking forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great staff, great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: yayaflirt
Reviews.Content: Flatiron Hotel was a great place to stay. We caught the train to Penn Station and with suitcases were able to walk to the hotel in about 10-15 minutes. Penn Station is on 31st and the Flatiron is on 26th, which was a few blocks over. The room was beautiful with a TV in the bathroom mirror, remote control curtains and a great iPod docking radio. Bathroom was really nice and everything was really clean. We arrived in New York around noon and were allowed to check in early and get our day of shopping started. The general manager George Sallee was fantastic and recommended several restaurants and tourist attractions. They told us if we got lost to feel free to call them and ask for help, and I believe they really meant it. The Toshi Lounge had happy hour with two for one drinks and we were able to meet with friends, talk and drink in the fabulous lobby and Toshi area lounge. The fish tank is beautiful and Jessica and Ldeka were very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to the pickiest traveler, as I am. I've stayed at the Gansevoort which is double the price, but service was not as great as the Flatiron. If you are looking for an outstanding boutique hotel, this is it! I haven’t been to a Marriot, Westin, W, Hilton or Sheraton that was better. It reminded me of the Venetian that we stayed at in Vegas, which was really nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Flatiron was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Darryn B
Reviews.Content: The Flatiron hotel is in the heart of the Flatiron district in NYC. The area itself is full of attractions to tourists such as Mario Batali's "Eataly," Jay-Z's "40/40 club", the Flatiron building itself, Teddy Roosevelt's birthplace and many more. The hotel is new and still in its opening phase, so there are a few hiccups here and there, but the overall experience FAR outweighs any negatives. The lobby is lovely with a huge unique saltwater aquarium surrounded by a transparent spiral staircase. There is live music at night with a great jazz ensemble. The room itself is wonderfully apportioned and the bathroom has a TV in the mirror. We had some difficulty using the Wi-Fi and had to be in certain places in the room to get it, but I'm sure that's a minor kink to be worked out. The thermostat settings were a bit touchy, so we found it better to leave it alone. There are those who complained about the subway noise - and while noticeable, I have to say my take was "Welcome to New York City." There's nothing they can do about that now.. and if anything, if you want to visit other parts of the city, you know that the subway is close by! You're in walking distance to Times Square (16 blocks - we did it with a 7 y/o) and a nice park around the corner. We found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating. Overall, my family VERY MUCH enjoyed the stay and we would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Flatiron!”
Reviews.Author: Deena L
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to recommend the Flatiron Hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in NYC. We had never been to New York and weren't sure what to expect, but found the Flatiron by luck and the nightly rate seemed very fair. (It was about $250 per night for the Toshi suite.) The hotel is in a great location - a block from one of the subway lines, and walking distance from A LOT of sights. Our room was very high tech with remote controlled window coverings and a television built in to the bathroom mirror. Cool stuff! The Toshi suite is a corner room with windows covering two walls and it was worth the little bit of extra cost because it was a lot of fun watching all the New York sights below us. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was well run and very clean. If we return to New York we will definately stay at the Flatiron again!

Reviews.Title: “A real NYC gem”
Reviews.Author: PlacidCasual45
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Flatiron Hotel (aside from the gorgeous fishtank that catches your eye the moment you step into the lobby) is just how unique it feels. The room we stayed in was a tech-geek delight with remote control curtains, iPod dock, HD TV, complementary Wi-Fi, touch controls for the door signs and the much mentioned 'TV within a bathroom mirror' (which is just cool, no two ways about it!). A decent size, too. A clean, comfortable bed and a really nice shower unit sealed the deal. The staff were very friendly and incredibly helpful. One day after an lengthy sight-seeing tour, we got back to find they had very kindly taken our luggage (lost at the airport for one day) up to our room so we had it waiting on our return. It's all in the little touches, and it was very much appreciated. If you're looking to get out and see the sights, the Flatiron Hotel's location is really second to none. Close enough to the main sights and attractions of Manhattan, but far away enough to be a little haven at the end of a long days sight-seeing or shopping. Yes, you can hear taxi horns and sirens at night and the occasional rumbling of a subway train, but we certainly didn't find it unbearable by any means. Plus, you just have to remember this is NYC... Tip: As it's a relatively new hotel, a number of the taxi drivers and shuttle bus employees looked puzzled when you gave them the name. Best to make a note of the address if you go out and about. I'll be recommending this hotel to friends and family, and given that it's still in the 'soft opening' stage (although the bar adjacent to the lobby is now open and looks great) it can only get even better. Well worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: dawn n
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the flatiron for our recent trip & we had a fantastic experience! We stayed in a Madison park double which was plenty of room for the 4 of us. (2 couples). After reading prior reviews we did request a top floor, you still hear some noise from outside, but that's NYC. The staff was very helpful in helping us get around the city. The hotel was very updated with still a different retro look in the bar area. Our only complaint was that you cannot use the fridge in your room unless you want charged for the items in it, howeve they explain it all up front & you can request a 2nd fridge be placed in your room. Overall we loved it & would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. The rooms are good and the shower is great.”
Reviews.Author: shootmenow13
Reviews.Content: Flatiron Hotel has been open for less than a year, so everything in the room seems new. The design is very modern and space efficient. I have stayed here twice and it is perfect for my business trips. The only gripe I had was the heater was really loud and would turn on only occasionally for long periods. So I was either hot or freezing.

Reviews.Title: “Commuication breakdown”
Reviews.Author: Surrealname
Reviews.Content: Flatiron Hotel itself is quite good - even trendy - clean and its location is very good indeed. No breakfast is available; however there are several establishments quite next door. There is a bar and some kind of "club" next to the lobby but luckily the sounds did not reach my room. Some street sounds and other quests' noise did not bother very much, but if you are a light sleeper you must remember that New York never sleeps. My biggest minus goes to the service. It seemed that I forgot something behind in the closet when I moved on. I contacted the front deskby phone 4 times during the following 10 days and left my phone number twice, all in vain. There seems to be major information breakdown between the front desk and housekeeping and also between the morning and and later shifts. All I needed to know if housekeeping had found one lost item in the room I stayed at - how much detective work does it take? They were just not able to tell me simply YES we found it or NO there was nothing left behind. ( I may have misplaced the item somewhere else, I just did not find it anymore during my trip.) The most absurd thing was when I informed the front desk that they should contact me at 2 pm at the latest on the day of my return flight, I got a text message at 2.30 pm that they will give me an answer "by the end of the day". So, no answer at all, thank you very much...

Reviews.Title: “Flatiron”
Reviews.Author: curious106
Reviews.Content: Location is great. The aquarium is beautiful. Staff for the most part are very helpful. We had the smallest room and that is very tiny, shower jet was wonderful. They held or bags on our last day there, they provided us with plastic spoons and got some ice (as there is no ice machine on the floors. The business center is completely free and when we were there not busy. All and all great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Carlea
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NYC and so glad we stayed at the Flatiron! The Toshi Corner Suites are so roomy and bathrooms are great. The hotel staff was so helpful, especially Steven and Alex. Steven suggested a great steakhouse for my daughter's 18th birthday dinner(Steak Frites) & helped us order tickets for 9/11 memorial. Great midtown location! Can't wait to visit NYC again and stay at the Flatiron. I have already recommended this hotel to friends who will traveling to NYC this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, staff were very helpfully”
Reviews.Author: lee_phillips123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, friendly staff, will definitely recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bella D
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay here not too long ago. The rooms were exceptionally clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Many thanks to George and the rest of the staff for making my visit to NYC a wonderful one!

Reviews.Title: “Mismanged, Overbooks and lies ..Dont trust them !”
Reviews.Author: John-manassas
Reviews.Content: BEWARE THIS HOTEL OVERBOOKS ! ..We checked in and they said 20 minutes untill the room would be ready , then 20 minutes latter they said it would be 6~8 hours to come back at 4:00 pm, go figure. OK ,So they checked our bags in and we came back at 4:00. THEN , they said there wasnt any rooms left because something had happened to an entire floor of the hotel. The manager said there had been an "event" and it couldnt be helped. THIS WAS A FLAT OUT LIE. The hotel shuttle driver accidentally told us the truth , that they had just overbooked by like 12 rooms. They offered to pay for us to stay at the Four points , I heard that they had done this for 12 rooms that day alone. The Hotel shuttle driver told us they had just overbooked by 12 rooms and he had been shuttling people all day. The staff was sooo disorganized , the communication was pathetic , they simply didnt have anything together. The lobby looked nice , good luck if you book this room !

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: monica_e_kim
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for couple days, the hotel was very clean and nice. Everyone there was nice, especially George who made sure that we had everything we needed and gave us some great tips bout navigating the city for my parents who visited ny for the fist time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tina C
Reviews.Content: The Flatiron Hotel offered a perfect place for our recent visit to New York. The central location was a perfect stop between uptown and Soho. We were able to return to the hotel between our day excursions and our Broadway show and dinners out. Stayed with my sister and her teenage daughters. The bar area is quaint and very hip. Close to great restaurants and shopping. Chelsea is beautiful. The parking associated with this hotel is inexpensive ($105 for 3 days) and very safe. All around great stay. Thanks Flatiron.

Reviews.Title: “Freaky Hotel on Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Cancun24
Reviews.Content: First off, make sure you know the address if your taking a taxi to the hotel, its not a known hotel for taxi drivers as I got the experience first hand. The hotel is really nice and sheek and freaky. Huge Aquarian in the loby with tropical fish. Automatic curtains to close and open, digital do not disturb sign, TV in bathroom mirror. (not sure if all rooms are like this, We were on the 10th floor, so who knows) Surround sound TV, nice flat screen TV and a fridge but dont touch anything, what you pick up you pay. Just tell the front desk you didnt know just incase. Really nice hotel, got amazing deal on hotwire $95 a night. Free internet and printer if you need to print a boarding pass. Wireless internet in room. Front desk staff, very nice, gave me free pouches of toothpaste. Very comfortable bed and very clean hotel. One advice, ask for the 10th floor room, the subway runs thru the hotel, you can hear it if your a light sleeper, not really a big deal to me, I heard it. Also, the noise with all the NY Taxi's honking, you can hear it pretty clear. Location is perfect for MSG and shopping. About a 7 mins walk to Macy's and MSG.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation #1540247 - Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: jerrySF
Reviews.Content: So the Flatiron had my first review deleted, claiming that I had not stayed at the property, so I’m sharing my res number. If they claim I didn’t stay there a second time, I assume they’ll give me a refund? I booked a stay at the Flatiron on 2/17. The dates I booked were 2/22 to 2/24. After booking the hotel, I made flight plans and unfortunately had to book a redeye flight. I then contacted the Flatiron by phone and very clearly offered to add one night’s room on the beginning of my stay so that a room would be ready for me when I arrived at 7AM in the event that an early registration would not be possible. Jessica, who I spoke with, said that she “locked” that room and that an early check in would be possible. Again to be completely clear, I offered to book another night’s stay to ensure early check in, but was told by the Flatiron not to do so. Upon arrival early in the morning on the 22, I was informed that no room was available and that the room had been rented the night before…I would have to wait. I went to a Starbucks and waited about 2.5 hours until they had a room available. Not a huge inconvenience. Unfortunately that was pretty much the highlight of my stay there. It became such a comedy of errors that I ultimately suspected that they were messing with me intentionally. - I went to the front desk in the evening of my first day and extended my stay one day. The clerk made the change and told me I would receive an email confirmation. When it had not arrived by the next morning, I again stopped by the front desk to confirm. Either of those interactions would have been idea times for the front desk staff to offer to redo my key entry card – on three occasions the last two days of my stay, I couldn’t get into my room and had to go back down to the desk and reques that the key card be adjusted. - The WiFi service ONLY extended to the 8 to 10 inches closest to the room door. I called the front desk two nights in a row and both times and was told that the “web guy” wasn’t on duty, so please use the business center. - The Jacuzzi tub in my room did not work. I called the desk on the first night, no one ever came up. - When I got to my room on the third evening, it had not been cleaned. Had to ring the front desk two times requesting service. When they did service the room, they neglected to leave any bath towels. There’s more but that’s about all the space I have. I understand errors and I also believe that often times when one error occurs for whatever reason, seems like chances are something else will go wrong. So in all honestly I would have likely laughed all of this off if the Flatiron had not successfully gotten my earlier review removed. That speaks to their character and should serve as a warning sign to anyone considering staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: laurie484
Reviews.Content: Will definitely stay here again. Customer service was very nice, gave us a free upgrade to a king size room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Rodney A
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful stay and really enjoyed the conversations and customer service provided especially by George, Jessica, Yomayra,Terrance and Allen with dash away limo...We will definately be coming back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Switched rooms 4 Times & Still found Hair in the beds”
Reviews.Author: aliciasturdy
Reviews.Content: The end of last month I was traveling to visit family and decided to treat myself to a night in the city using one of my free http://Hotel.com nights. I was debating between this hotel and an UWS one, but chose this one because it's proximity to the subway and my favorite coffee shop (perfect to grab breakfast/coffee on my way to the airport). To sum up my 90 minutes in hell with the Flatiron staff: I ended up switching rooms 4 times because in each room there were either tiny black hairs in the bed or in one bed there were long black strands of hair & blood on the duvet. The front desk manager I dealt became more insensitive & cold each time I had to deal with him. Also, it seems this hotel encourages it's staff to remain unprofessional. None of the housekeeping/maintenance employees were in any kind of uniform, the "General Manager" gave me his card in which his former title "Housekeeping Manager" was scribbled out and "G.M." was written above it. He also gave me his cell phone number (which he had to look up on his phone?) to call him next time I was in the city and he assured me "he'd take care of my visit". Not once was I offered an upgrade for my inconvenience, any kind of refund, comped room, or anything that would have made my stay more pleasant beyond the vague "call me and we'll take care of you" thing. I was made to feel like a nuisance & very unwelcome, and I think that would make any guest at any hotel upset.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Flatiron Hotel for her birthday weekend getaway. I have to say the facility was top notch. The staff were very accommodating when unfortunate circumstances changed our travel plans at the last minute. The rooms are small (it's NYC though so that's expected) but well equipped with high end furnishings, bathroom fixtures and electronics. We were also able to check our bags in at the front desk and leave them there after we checked out. This allowed us to enjoy NYC for an extra day without hauling our bags around town. Overall it was a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay, located close to subway.”
Reviews.Author: JanJayTravels
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal reserving our stay through Hotwire at half the price. I just got back from our trip (Feb 16 - 19) with my husband. We were booked for 2 beds and I made a number of requests, which they happily provided. Since it was only the 2 of us, I requested to have the King size bed and from reading the reviews here about the noise, I also requested for rooms in higher floors. We end up getting a small cozy king bed room on the 8th floor in the hotel. We still were able to hear the trains passing through, but the bed was so comfortable and my added exhaustion from traveling the city, we were totally out and sleeping like babies. The room was very modern and clean, we had fun with the remote curtains and the TV in the washroom mirror, but had a problem setting the alarm. Wish there were instructions on how to use the alarm clock in the room. As the alarm would set off the curtains to automatically open and the heat to turn on. There wasn't enough towels, so we had to request for more. We had a mini fridge full of items, but no place to put our own items. So, we end up taking out some cans to cool our own items and placing them back when we left. We found out afterwards, the mini fridge keeps tabs of items you take out for more than 20 sec and charges it on the bill. When we checked out, we were charged for the cans, but the clerks removed the charge, as we told them we didn't consume the drinks and only use it for fridge space to put our own items. So, we will see later if they still charged us for the items on our credit cards. We had trouble controlling the temperature in the room. It was either too cold or too hot. There was also a delay with hot water for showering. It took about 5 mins to get the hot water running for our showers. There were some misses but the stay was overall enjoyable, as we just need a place to sleep. The hotel is conveniently located close to the subway. The reception will recommend you to take the subway on the 23rd, but we learned that there was a closer stop on the 28th and Broadway, which is about a 5-10 mins walk to the hotel. I would definitely come back for another stay here as the location is great and the service satisfied our needs for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience all around!”
Reviews.Author: LillyJr
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. They made me feel comfortable asking any little question. They even recommended a good sushi place nearby. The room is small... but it is NY and either way we spent 10% of our time there. Very clean and cute space. The location is also a plus close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: tanager1
Reviews.Content: Kind service, decent room, fun tech gadgets. Location very convenient to sights, restaurants, activities: walk to MSG, Times Square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenniferam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 2/15/12 through 2/19/12 with my husband. we stayed in a king size room. The previous comments made me nervous, so we requested a room on the upper floor, which they accommodated (7th floor). yes, you can hear the vibrations of the train below, but you couldn't hear street noise. and the train vibration wasn't a big deal. Very light sleepers probably have a problem with everything in NYC. Pros: for NYC the room is good sized. people not familiar with NYC might be shocked by room sizes here, but it is new york. I saw the queen size rooms, and they are much smaller than the king. The bed was comfy, room was clean (we were nervous about bed bugs - no issue at all), the tech features were cool. Ipod radio was nice, the black out shades worked really well. bathroom was large/clean. i wish our room had the cool showers i saw in the queen room (I peeked into a few other rooms during the mid day while housekeeping was cleaning). but the bathroom with the tub was much bigger. The hairdryer was a real hairdryer, not the typical hotel crappy thing (wish i knew ahead of time, i could have packed less). the tv in the bathroom mirror was a novelty, but not really my thing. the location is AMAZING!! this is exactly where i want to be in NYC. The cost was great, but i assume it will go up in price as it gets more well known. we met the owner one night - he's really energetic and seems to care a lot about this project. It's not like a big corporation is running this show - it's small and getting attention from the owner. Thats nice to see. Room safe is so well hidden, we had to call the front desk to find out where it was... but it's there. Meh?: the lobby is interesting.... clean but a bit over the top for me. Is this a con? probably not, but not anything special for me. The decor overall is not exactly my taste, but at least more playful than most hotels. there weren't any places to really hang out in the lobby other than just some couches. it wasn't the type of place i would like to just hang out. Not bad for sitting and waiting for someone, but not a "place" yet. Other hotels do this much better. Cons: wish there was a mini fridge in the room. it has cooler selling water/soda, but no space for our food. The bar just opened while we were there. The liquor selection is not great. the bar tender gets an A for effort, but not execution. I'm going to assume they just need some more time and experience. and some nibbles. Another Con - the hotel doesn't yet have any thing other than just rooms. No cafe, no food, etc. However, starbucks is right next door and the neighborhood has so much. All in all, for the cost savings, i would prefer to spend the extra money on doing something outside of my hotel than just paying for hotel accoutrements. overall, i highly recommend this hotel. we were very happy with it. our "cons" are minor, while the pros were great.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific hotel!:)”
Reviews.Author: jvincent44
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through "Hotwire." Terrific price and fantastic room (great location, too)... Book it! Staff wass terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FRQTFLYR
Reviews.Content: My friend and I ended up staying at the Flatiron Hotel in NYC for 3 nights. We booked it through Hotwire and got a pretty amazing deal on the room! The hotel lobby is very chic and trendy, very hip and modern. The front desk staff were all welcoming and pretty cool. The cylindrical aquariam is really something to see! The rooms were quite nice, size was typical of other NYC hotels. Great things about the room were the electronic curtain/window shades, the TV in the bathroom mirror, the shower stall with all the spa jets was really nice after a long day in the city. Probably the most amazing thing about the room were the comfort of the beds!! I have never slept on anything like that before and it was truly an amazing experience. Somethings that could have been worked on...the heater is pretty loud and blasts hot air into the room. It was hard to get a stable temperature in the room. Also, the tile floor in the bathroom was freezing cold on barefeet. It would have been nice to have heated tile floors or even provide guests with complimentary slippers. Also, there were no towel racks at all in the bathroom! After showering we would just throw the towels on the floor or leave them on the counter. Sometimes I would hang them on top of the door. i think this is something they perhaps missed??? It also would have been nice to have real glasses to use in the hotel room, rather than the flimsy plastic cups sealed in celophane that they give you. That just makes the room look cheap. They also need to upgrade the quality of coffee in the room. While it was nice to have the coffeemaker and complimentary coffee, the quality was very poor. We walked to Starbucks in the morning to get real coffee. I think that fixing up these little snags will make this an even better hotel than it already is. I would definitely choose to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: hkh12
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal through Bookit.com, and it ended up being a good decision. Its in a great location. We were only a couple of blocks from our bus stops. It's a bit of a walk to Times Square, but it's not that bad. The lobby was small, but inviting. Check-in was a breeze. The guy (I wish I remembered his name!) at the front desk gave us great advice for navigating around NYC and great recommendations for late night food. The room was awesome. It was small, which is normal for the city. The bed was comfortable. I loved the shower, the lights that dim above the bed, the keyless entry, and the button for "Housekeeping" and "Do Not Disturb," instead of the typical doorhanger. And the BF loved the tv in the mirror. Koreatown is a couple of blocks over, with tons of places to eat. It's a great place to stay if you plan on checking out other stuff besides Times Square. The iconic Flatiron Building can be seen from the end of the street, and there's a great park nearby to have a picnic or to rest up. Dillon was so nice during checkout. We left our bags at the hotel since we had a late bus. When coming back for our bags, Dillon saw that we had some food and offered us the lounge area to eat and rest before traveling, which we took up on. I loved the fact that this was a boutique hotel and not a chain. It was cozy, the staff was friendly, and it was quiet. I've already recommended this hotel to someone that's visiting NYC in the spring. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern small hotel in chelsea”
Reviews.Author: fatcontroller1999
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate here down to the renovation works that are going on at the moment. Fine for me as the work is on the ground floor during the day (they are working on the bar). Staff very friendly and helpful, rooms are beautiful with lots of nice gadget touches (tv in bathroom mirror, electric curtains, iPod dock etc). effective heating/cooling and a decent room size. Just round the corner from the flatiron building, close to tea and coffee shops overlooking the square. Would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Char B
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this boutique hotel but there are definitely some areas that need improvement. Stayed for three nights. Room was very small and cramped partially mitigated with high ceilings. Great mattress and comfy bed but no extra blankets and a very noisy HVAC system. No table, no lamp and no lighting controls on one side of the bed. Where are you supposed to put your glasses or turn on a light in the middle of the night? First day of housekeeping they brought no washcloths and all hand towels and did not replace the drinking glasses. Second day of housekeeping, there was none - housekeeping was a no-show as of 4:30pm when we returned to our room after being gone from 8:30am. When I complained about both housekeeping issues (I had left a note about the washcloths and glasses but no housekeeper showed up to read it) someone finally brought washcloths to the room an hour later. Never did get any drinking glasses. Seems like a minor detail until you try to take a pill. Sign says they are in their soft opening but staff said they opened last August. That is plenty of time to get the kinks worked out... Staff was pleasant, location was OK thought the street where the hotel entrance is located is off the beaten path and a bit sketchy at night. Some common areas were still under construction and the lack of any kind of dining was a bit inconvenient, especially for breakfast. I would give them another try if the price was right...

Reviews.Title: “Flatiron Hotel - Fantastic Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sara V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, I highly recommend it. The location is perfect, we were able to walk everyone, Times Square, Tribeca, SoHo, Central Park... (if you're lazy you may want to take a cab, these are not short walks). I think for the price it's pretty much the best hotel in NYC. The beds were super comfy and the linens were high quality, 4 star all the way! The shower was awesome; with jets, rainwater showerhead etc. The monogrammed towels were good quality, the hair blow dryer was a proper one, not the usual hotel nightmare. Our room was large, 2 double beds with lots room to walk around. The electronic curtaisn were cool, same with the tv in the bathroom. And our room had an ipod docking station, which is always a nice touch. I was worried about noise because of the complainers on here, we didn't have any issues. I think I heard a horn honking a couple of times... but that's to be expected in any city. I didn't hear the supposed train noises at all. (We were on the 3rd floor). The lobby is really cool, hip furniture and a cool fishtank. If you are the pickiest person ever, you might not like that the toilet roars when it flushes (it's powerful)... I didn't find it a problem, but you can hear it with the door closed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blitzjb
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here this past weekend. Great location and walking distance to great shops and restaurants. How can it be bad being across from Shake Shack and a block from Eataly? Entire building is spotless. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Cant wait to return. As an added bonus, we were able to park on the stree steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jchoumane
Reviews.Content: We were pleasingly surprised of how nice the hotel and the location were. The staff is very friendly especially the hotel driver.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM in the Flatiron District!”
Reviews.Author: Susanm56
Reviews.Content: LOVED this Hotel! Was thinking I should keep my opinion to myself because I'm afraid it will get too popular and I won't be able to get a room when I need it! The location was perfect, the lobby cool, the front desk people were wonderful and my room was sublime! Super comfy Bed and Bedding, small but perfect bath with a fabulous shower and a TV in the mirror! They kindly kept my bag for me until I was ready to depart from the city. The perfect location for me. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie44124
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised: location was very good, hotel was clean and modern ( a little too modern for me - too many lighted screens - too much night lights). Bedding was clean and bed was very comfortable; bathroom was very petite but extremely comfortable. I had read the reviews of the hotel, and was concerned about subway noise- didn't hear a thing! The street noise was way too loud but it has nothing to do with the hotel- and everything to do with busy location in the middle of Broadway ( my room was on the 8th floor). I will stay there again if I will be able to get it at the same $98 rate !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tess0114
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and will come back for sure. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was in the 3rd floor with minimal street noise, did not bother us at all. Room was very clean. Location was great. It was a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Flatiron in Chelsea (NYC)”
Reviews.Author: MiamiRR
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in NYC as a family (3 kids ages 6 to 12 years) and LOVED this hotel. The room was beautifully appointed with all sorts of electronic gadgets, including automatic curtain closers which the kids loved (along with the TV screen built into the bathroom mirror and the amazing fish tank in the lobby). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the room was spotless. However, Room 504 faced the street and was drafty and a bit noisy; the windows are original, single pane windows. Got a great deal thru Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I mean, WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Pandora2210
Reviews.Content: First of all, i hardly ever write reviews but i had to on this place. Looking online, there had been some mixed reviews about the Flatrion Hotel, but once we arrived, all of our doubts were immediately dismissed. The front desk staff was really knowledgeable about the area and they mapped out routes for us to do what we had wanted to and recommended some great places to eat. Housekeeping was perfect, not a spot or thing missed in the room through out our stay, they were all so warm and friendly we really felt like they appreciated us. Wish I could've brought that bed home with us. :)) I will definitely be coming back on my next trip and will be recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: papillonheart
Reviews.Content: I have to say my favorite boutique hotel is The Dream in Midtown. My stay there went ultra smooth, it was a great location and I felt safe. My stay was from Friday - Sunday. The Flatiron is shiny and new but there are a few improvements needed: Cons: 1. Sensitive to noise, I specifically requested in my reservation booked weeks ahead, NOT to have a room by the elevator, and they did the complete opposite. My room literally faced the elevator. Takes literally just one leap from the inside of the elevator into my room. I called down to the front immediately realizing this and they said they'll check and call me back if anything. So they called back literally 1 whole minute later and said there wasn't anything available. Seriously, they could have waited 5 minutes to pretend they tried. This showed me they are not accommodating and do not care to show they want to make an effort! I was ready to look for a new hotel at this point. 2. Since there was nothing they can do about my room situation, and i was in a time crunch, I just sucked it up and stayed. I got there on Friday afternoon and I needed to work a bit before the weekend. For a few hours I was working in my room and all of a sudden someone opens the door into my room! The voices of two adult men were behind my door about to walk in! I quickly said "HELLO!" They stopped opening the door halfway and did not see me but heard my voice. I panicked!! I thought I was getting robbed or worst going to be assaulted!!! So I quickly grabbed my laptop ready to whack the people coming in. Then they said "um, are you decent? we're here to check something!" Are you kidding me? I could have been in a very vulnerable situation! Oh, and the room I was in did not have one of those long hook locks that keeps people out even if they have a key. So this is a very unsafe situation for a single female traveling alone. I put down my laptop and walked to the door to see what they wanted. And they said they just wanted to check to see if something in the bathroom was fixed. So one guy peeked into the bathroom and said it was. I was just still in shock and disbelief in what was happening. So the shorter guy saw this and asked "what's wrong." I'm like "um. well, most people knock before they just walk into someone's room" And they explained that they thought no one was checked in yet and the other guy said a matter of factually "you just checked in like 5 mins ago right? so ..." I'm like I've been here, working! Jerk! God the rudeness of this hotel at this point was almost too much to take. If I didn't have to finish a report and meet someone soon I would have packed my stuff and moved to another hotel. 3. The noise level is outrageous! I can sleep through fog horns and earthquakes but this room was beyond those things. I heard the TV of the room next door all night long and loud too, the walls are thin. The trains are also passing by every so often. Because my room was so low in the building, I can hear every honk, siren, and crazies shouting! Oh and people in and out of the elevators didn't help either! Those noises went on all night long. 4. One ice machine for the whole hotel, in Mezzanine level and no vending machines for softdrinks or water. (they are working on setting up minibars in the hotel rooms) They did suggest we go across the street to the liquor store to get water/softdrinks, which we did and it was convenient enough. Pros: Everything is new. The curtains are electronically controlled, you open and close them with a remote!!! Really fun. The curtains keep the light out very well. So even if it's super bright out, the room can be dark. The phone in room is cordless. The TV was crisp (but it is digital so a lot of channels didn't have signal, since I don't watch much tv, I don't consider this too bad an issue) The desk was good for working (though there were no power outlets where the desk is so my cords were connected to the walls on the other side, not too big a deal for me) Two new bathrobes. The shower was awesome, it had a total of 8 spouts and 7 running at a time so you're getting sprayed from head to knees with multiple spouts, LOVE this feature. There's a TV in the bathroom mirror (which can be a good or bad thing, I didn't like it because it got in my way of seeing myself since I'm short. And it's not facing the toilet, so you can't watch it from there. You can see it from the shower but can't hear it since shower is so loud) I think they tried with this but it ultimately does not make much since. Lighting in the rooms are well situated and can be adjusted for bright to dim to romantic. Electronic control for Privacy and Maid Service. The lobby is very nice, with cool furnishing and a large cylinder aquarium. The doorman/luggage guys are very nice and quick to come to help me. Girl who checked me in was also nice. The location, right by beautiful Madison Square Park (depending on the type of person you are, it can be a shady spot at night, but I liked it because it was walking distance from all the places I ate at in LES and East Village. Don't expect upper east side or midtown when staying here. There are characters and you should be alert as you walk through the neighborhood) Two short blocks from the Subway station. Very easy to catch a cab. They have car service if you need it ( i didn't use it but looks convenient) All in all, my stay (after my first few hours of weirdness) went smooth. I would stay here again, but I would definitely call ahead to make sure they won't put my room in front of the elevators and hopefully by then, they would have installed long hook locks so strangers can't just bust into your room if you're in the shower or doing something more private!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic week at the Flatiron Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hillary P
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 5 night stay at the Flatiron Hotel while visiting NYC on business. I could not have asked for a more comfortable, enjoyable stay! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the room was great. The room I stayed in was very quiet, with minimal street noise, and I was on the 7th floor. It also had an amazing shower with all the necessities and the bed was always fresh and comfortable. The location was close to shops, restaurants, the drug store, and the subway. Very convenient and enjoyable! I look forward to staying at the Flatiron Hotel again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buzz355
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend of 12/17/2011. Booked 2 full size rooms with two beds and requested high floors due to some earlier reviews on this site which mentioned subway noise. Upon arrival, they said they only had side by side rooms on the lower floors. When I pointed out that I had requested rooms on the higher floors, they gave us rooms on floor 9 and 10. The 10th floor appears to be the highest. They then upgraded us to corner rooms - very nice. The rooms were very nice, spacious, and had lots of bells and whistles. The jacuzzi tub was wonderful to use. The electronic operated curtains were also a nice touch. Check in was effortless and they were very accommodating when we asked to store our luggage for the afternoon after we checked out. I wouldn't worry about the subway noise. The subway does run underneath the hotel and you can hear it. However, you can drown out the intermittent subway noise with white noise generated by the heating/ac unit. Set the fan for continuous operation. It is fairly loud and it effectively drowns out the subway noise. Works like a charm. This is a small boutique hotel and I think it has a great location and a great pricing. The pricing was attractive because of the soft opening of the hotel. I would definitely stay there again if I can obtain a similar rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot - clean, new, and nicely appointed”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Traveler_2
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly...what a great new addition to the Flatiron neighborhood! The rooms aren't huge, but they are certainly ample enough (especially for New York). The beds are very comfortable, the bathrooms are new and very fresh, and the staff is very helpful (especially Terrance, who works in the evenings). Plus, there's that truly awesome, two-story fish tank in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Amhtruitt
Reviews.Content: Pros - price was right for a family of four making a last minute trip to NYC. $269 for 2 double beds. Location was great, room was outstanding (newly renovated) Staff was very helpful and friendly. Cons - street noise. May have been the corner room and the wall of windows (which was a good thing for the view). If you are a light sleeper may want to request a room away from street. Bottom line - We will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Jim from NJ”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay very much. All the electronics were fun. The shower was great. We have seen nothing like it. Management was very good and helpful. The price was reasonable and the room was comfortable and clean. The fish tank was amazing and the lobby was great for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kim S
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the room through Travelocity and had a wonderful experience. The service was excellent from the moment we arrived. Terrance was accomodating and very helpful. The staff even stored our luggage for several hours after we checked out so that we could enjoy the rest of the day. We loved our room and all its finishing touches. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for whirlwind city stay”
Reviews.Author: cia396
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the room- 140 incl. tax on bookit.com- and all of the little extras were wonderful! The aquarium was beautiful and the rooms, though very cozy, had fun touches with a remote for the curtains, iPod dock w surround sound, a tv in the bathroom and a great shower. The location is perfect especially if you don't like being trapped in midtown- you're a short walk away from everything. I could see a longer stay being uncomfortable with the room size and the tv was spotty- a lot of channels didn't come in. I don't know if its worth the $300/night they ask but if you find a deal, it's a great getaway!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Ross M
Reviews.Content: It is a 3 Star Hotel with a 1 Star management. We had problems with bites for one bed, and rash in another. The hotel refused to refund our unused 4 nights. Expedia also refused to refund this, and we could not stay in the hotel. Additionally, there a no fridges in the room - they charge $10 extra a night for fridge. The management took 15 minutes to check us in. The elevator also was not working.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kbfz
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. Room was very clean and bathroom was quite spacious. Shower was a bit noisy but it did not bother us. Everyone was helpful and friendly. Our room was upgraded and we had a late check-out. We hope to stay there again and look forward to the bar being open.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “A good new option”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new, so it's super clean and well decorated. The rooms are far nicer and bigger than what you'd normally get in NY at this price. I only had two gripes: 1. the parking garage they contract with down the street was full, and the attendant was completely disinterested in helping me; and 2. they do have an ice machine, but there are no minibars or even a soda machine on premises, which I found odd.

Reviews.Title: “Gem”
Reviews.Author: w3jane
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on a recommendation from a friend who has stayed at The Flatiron, but were a little nervous. We've had some terrible hotel experiences in New York City (especially downtown) but this place is a true gem! The extremely friendly front desk staff, the location, and the overall style of the place is unmatched. My boyfriend and I are already trying to nail down some dates to return in the spring. The front desk staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. They offered us some great "off the beaten path" recommendations for places to eat and things to do that made our trip really special. The rooms, though small (it's New York) were immaculate and all the special features (automatic curtains, lighting, tvs in the bathroom, etc) were SUPER cool. We ended up spending most of our time inside the room instead of exploring the city but oh well :) Really excited for the future of this place! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully unique”
Reviews.Author: CWToronto
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed 3 days at this hotel. The location was great for getting around downtown NYC. The rooms were a reasonable size for the city, the shower was small but fantastic, and the lobby has an amazing massive aquarium as a centerpiece. Service was well intentioned, if inept. Eataly is one block away, and the best coffee at Stumptown is 3 blocks north.

Reviews.Title: “New York Experience~”
Reviews.Author: Haylee B
Reviews.Content: When I visit New York (which is not often), I am always looking for a place that gives me that "New York" Experience. This was my first time staying at The Flatiron Hotel and everything was just as I had hoped. The Front Desk Staff was so friendly and educated on the surrounding area, with great suggestions on places to eat and local attractions. I really enjoyed the cozy feel and look of the room we stayed in. This hotel was much cleaner than other hotels I have stayed at in New York, so I was thoroughly impressed by that. All around it was a great stay and I am very happy we chose this hotel to stay at! A WONDERFUL New York Experience thanks to The Flatiron Hotel! We will definitely be back~ Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: Dameon S
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my fiance and I have stayed here. The hotel is in its soft opening, but regardless, this is the place for us. They have taken such good care of us everytime we come that its going to be tough to beat, I cant wait for the restaurant and bar to open. It seems like each time I stay, there have a change in staff, and it seems to be for the better in every situation. The gentleman with glasses was knowledgeable and welcomed us back. Every time he saw us he knew us by name. The rooms are always clean and the tech is cool, They have tvs in the bathroom, automatic curtains, and great lighting that you can set to any mood. I highly reccomend this place. It will only get better once they are running at full capacity. Thank You Sooo much for being great to me Flatiron!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location....”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl11008
Reviews.Content: I was not sure about this hotel because it was still in the soft opening stages, but I am so happy my husband and I stayed here. Staff was wonderful, hotel was cozy and quiet, our king size bed/room was clean an comfy, and after a long day of sight seeing in the cold it was nice to come back to a wall jet shower. The hotel has no room service/ restaurant but that was no big deal because restaurants/delis were walking distance. This is our new spot when we come back to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Trip”
Reviews.Author: annie0806
Reviews.Content: Clean, new, could be great. Stayed during "soft opening", no restaurant, no hotel info binder. Rooms were small, bathroom small, small vanity, but shower was excellent. Front desk personnel very friendly and helpful. Definitely not a 4 star yet.

Reviews.Title: “No Soap??”
Reviews.Author: bobbylupo
Reviews.Content: It was a rainy day but the hotel was well lit inside. Modern flair. Round fishtank that spans 2 floors. Very clean and new. A few minor detail items such as the elevator wrap on the doors and the stainless steel ceiling in the elevator still had the protective wrap in the corners. Rooms were High tech with automatic shades, recessed lighting and touch pad controllers. Closet could not fit a hanger straight. There was no bar soap in the hotel so they supplies extra shower gel..... Staff was friendly and location is nice. At $300.00 a nite, I expected a bit more but would go back if they ran a special.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for prime time!”
Reviews.Author: ibraiker
Reviews.Content: This good be a fine hotel, but, it is not yet operated very well. Not very polished, misses on all the little things and even a couple of the big ones! I stayed for 3 nights and never received a normal bar of soap I had requested, mind you nothing special just a regular bar of soap. I finally went out myself to the nearest Duane Reed and purchased one. Every little thing that one would expect in a 3 star, let alone 4 star hotel was absent. Someday they will get their act together and it will be a charming place to stay, just not yet!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: E P
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4.5 start hotel and don't let anyone tell you otherwise. The check-in process took forever and no one really seemed to know what was going on. They must have run out of standard rooms because I was "upgraded" to a larger room, which was a nice surprise, but when I tried to watch TV I discovered it was broken. I called the front desk and they sent someone up who couldn't figure out why it wasn't working either. "No problem", I thought to myself, I'll just go for a workout in their fitness center. Except the treadmill was broken too. I headed back to my room to write some emails before heading to bed, but found their internet was spotty and after 30 minutes of trying to get a connection just gave up and turned in for the night. That didn't work either due to the fact that the subway was so close to the building that it practically shook my room every hour on the hour throughout the night. The hallways were dirty and some of the construction in the room was falling apart. The elevator sounds like its run by a hamster in a hamster wheel. Don't stay here, you can find a better hotel in Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey postage stamp room”
Reviews.Author: DomenicaA
Reviews.Content: Our teeny tiny room rocked from the noises on the street including the rumble of the subway and street traffic. The bed was on a platform with drawers for storing our stuff... the only storage space in the room. Really claustrophobic experience that cost a bundle. Don't expect complimentary breakfast or coffee. That said, I do appreciate the early check in by the cordial folks at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: brian b
Reviews.Content: we arrived later in the day but very helpful staff got us tickets to a broadway play (fantastic seats, row 6 centre) and generally made our stay perfect. The bed was excellent but room on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel at the great location”
Reviews.Author: BritteCDM
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in November. The room was roomy as a New York standard. The comtemporary interier and clean. There was a TV in the bathroom millar. Only one negative comment is the shower water. It took a LONG time (the longest was almost 10 minutes) to get the hot water. Over all the stay was very pleasent. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will be excellent as soon as they come up to speed”
Reviews.Author: rstachel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our two night stay. The room and the entire hotel has a modern decor. Clean and comfortable. Many cool touches such as the TV in the bathroom mirror (which also had LED lights), the touch panel 'Do Not Disturb", the rainfall shower head. Some features were not yet working: the surround sound speakers, the mini-fridge was not installed, and near the end of our stay the cool room keycard failed to the extent someone had to reprogram the room. The staff was helpful and appropriately apologetic about the minor glitches. The doorman was still a little unclear on the concept - we decided to hail a cab ourselves. I understand the hotel is recently opened - as soon as everything is installed and working properly it will be a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a night”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last night. Room was great. Lots of cool technology in them like a TV built into the mirror in the bathroom. Clean and cool ambiance, Staff very friendly. Lobby has a chiche look with huge fish tanks and cool lighting. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: TaraLeaE
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 5 nights at The Flatiron Hotel last week. While it is a nice hotel and the staff is friendly and accommodating it is not a four star hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They brought us up a mini fridge and coffee pot. The beds were comfy. What would make it a four star? Added touches like stationary, NY magazines, double paned windows, bell men, and room service. The location was fine for us...a bit out of the rat race, but for some, they may find it too far away from the hustle and bustle (we love to walk!) Would we stay here again? No, probably not. Would we recommend it to friends? Probably, with full disclosure.

Reviews.Title: “Who (k)new?”
Reviews.Author: cootmom
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to come across a deal from Bookit.com for <$300/night at this perfectly located (B'way and 26th) gem. Friendliest front desk staff ever. Then check out the gorgeous two story aquarium in the center of the lobby, and the retro staircase going up to the low ceilinged mezzanine. The room was bigger than most boutique hotels. The towels were larger. The bathrobe and slippers were cozier. Two bottles of normal spring water instead of the usual fancy ripoff bottled water that gets added to your bill. The shower was magnificent, plenty of jets and rip roaringly hot water right away. Comfy bed. The best lighting I've ever had for reading in a hotel. So clean that I think I might have been the first person to stay in the room! Filled with electronic gizmos to make your stay more interesting. Interesting in that I couldn't even figure out how to get into the room - the door doesn't have a slidey thing for your room card, instead you just touch it to the top of the latch (they should have told me!). Only drawbacks: no restaurant or bar, but they are coming. Also, the check in was late, 4 PM. Great experience at the Flatiron!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mich4434
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel in september for a vacation , i loved it so much i came back to it recently for another trip. Great hotel- very clean and updated. Its close to everything! Staff is super nice and helpful . Im always going and coming from new york and i wouldnt choose to stay anywhere else but here to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, new boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller441
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been newly refurnished, and the rooms are quite comfortable. Very central location in the heart of the city. The staff is friendly and available 24 hours a day. Showers have lots of nozzles that spray you from all angles at once. Definitely a great value for NYC and I would certainly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff with fun technology equiped rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andjoh
Reviews.Content: This is a newly opened hotel and when we visited the resturant was not yet open. This is not a problem really as there are plenty of places to eat nearby. The staff was very friendly and we alwas had a good feeling comming back to the hotell after a day out. The twin double bed rooms were large enough for us with two adults ald two kids to fit w/o any problems. A fun thing was the technology in the rooms including integrated TV in the bathroom mirror! Not very necessary, but fun :-)

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Biztravel284
Reviews.Content: We booked the Flatiron hotel in October for one night as we had a business meeting in the City. We booked a corner suite and once we arrived in our room we saw some immediate issues. The curtains did not close (they are controlled remotely), there was a loud subway noise every 10-15 minutes, and the room did not have a floor length mirror. The front desk was accommodating and moved us to a lower floor, which did have working curtains, but still there was loud subway noise and no mirror (we were told they were on order and were to arrive that week). We didn't spend much time in the room as we arrived back late and checked out early the next morning so we didn't think much of it..until we received our credit card statement the following month. In addition to the room charge there was an additional charge of $200.00 from the hotel. When I called the hotel to inquire about the charge, the person in reservations told me it was because both bed spreads were missing. I was completely shocked! I proceeded to tell the man on the phone that was an absurd allegation and that we absolutely did not steal anything. The man said someone would call me back and that he could not address this personally. After I did not receive a callback, I proceeded to call again and was able to speak to the person that was supposed to return my call. I again told him that they were wrong and that we absolutely did not steal the bed spreads and demanded a refund of the $200.00 or we would dispute the charge with the credit card company. He told me he would refund the money and apologized. I asked him why we did not receive a call to ask about this before charging our card and he said it was an oversight and again apologized. I would suggest anyone staying at this hotel be sure and check their credit card statements since this hotel happens to quietly add on charges without guests' knowledge. Who knows if the bed spreads were even really stolen. This hotel obviously employs thieves either way. Whether they are stealing items from the room and blaming it on guests....or just stealing money off of guests credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: vgreenshields1
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent three nights at the Flatiron in mid-October and were pleasantly surprised, considering some of the less-than-flattering reviews. Our room was fantastic! Very high tech with a remote control for the TV embedded in the bathroom mirror, curtains, main TV, etc. It also had an iPod docking station. The linens were beautiful and the room was tastefully decorated. The hotel was in the soft opening stage, and while the furnture was very nice, it was sparce in the foyer. The staff was very accommodating and friendly, particularly Dillon, GM Steve and the doorman. My only concern was a lack of security in the evening -- one evening there was no one at all in the foyer or reception area. Amenities of a traditional hotel also were lacking, with no concierge or restaurant, but front desk staff was helpful in suggesting local eateries. It is a fair walk to Times Square, but we did enjoy the less touristy location - and it was only one block from Eataly! We woudl definitely stay here on a future visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay at the Flatiron Hotel: mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: lecknox
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Flatiron hotel Oct 20-22, 2011. It is a newly renovated hotel, and this was a soft grand opening, thus the room rate was less than $300 per night for the 1 week night and one Friday night I was there. Lovely, clean lined foyer with a cylindrical two story tropical fish tank, and a glass circular stairway to the mezzanine. No restaurant in the hotel at this time. Location on Broadway was OK...just two blocks from the intersection of Broadway and Fifth Ave. Closest subway station was at least a three block walk. Staff was friendly and helpful. My room was one of the larger rooms on the 10th floor. The rooms were recently remodeled and I found them clean and neat. I do have two complaints on this hotel however. They did not put in new windows when they remodeled, so there is street noise that infiltrates the room at night. (however, west 26th is quiet at night) Then there the rumble of the subway running under the street at this location. The beautiful heavy, blackout drapes are automatic, you tug on them, and they open and close by themselves. This was fine, until they decided to open and close on their own at 7:30, 8, and again at 8:30 AM. My room was facing somewhat east, so the light was rather intense. I let the staff know that I had a unseen visitor playing with my curtains, and they said they would look into it immediately. When I returned, the issue seemed to be solved, curtains were closed, and didn't open until I tugged them when i got up the next morning. King size bed was Extremely comfy and made it difficult to get up in the AM. Connectivity via their wireless network was weak. I neglected to inquire about a hard cable connection in the room. The flat screen TV was nice, but had to be located at the other end of the long room. I am "blind" for long distances, so I needed my glasses to watch the TV from the bed. Overall, the stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning little hotel . . .”
Reviews.Author: marie32
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is new, and it shows in some respects, but it is gorgeous in it's details and a good value for NYC. The GM, Steven, will do whatever it takes to please (he even immediately resolved an issue on my bill without question) . . . no NYC attitude here. I enjoyed this hotel much more than the other larger hotels I've stayed in. The rooms are small, and the TV screen in the bathroom mirror makes it difficult for anyone under 6' to see very well, but stays in New York are generally short, so it's not a major issue. The location right on Broadway makes it super easy to get anywhere in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: sunarihost
Reviews.Content: The first night of a three night stay. Trying it out since I stay in NYC hotels 5-7 nights a month, Pluses-decent sized room and bath, lots of light, good tv. Minus-only one bedside table so when my wife arrives tomorow one of us will have to put glasses etc ont he floor. Bedlside lamp unplugged. Fancy electronic drapes yet crappy plastic drinking glasses and very cheap furniture and bath amenities. Pleasant enough desk staff but did not know wireless password

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a girls weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Tiff D
Reviews.Content: I just got back today from staying three nights here. My friends and I traveled all the way from Canada and felt very welcomed! Steven who worked at the front desk made the best impression for us. Genuinely nice and would do anything for you! I can almost guarantee he was the one that walked 7 blocks to get a taxi for the lady in the other review. There was no room service, but why would you stay inside to eat/drink when you are in New York City?! It was a great location as well. The taxi fares were never too expensive. Stay here! =)

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here - insulting customer "service"”
Reviews.Author: Ryan F
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. I cancelled my reservation in advance of my stay, only to learn that my credit card was still charged for one night's stay plus tax because I didn't meet the "72 hour cancellation policy". I was never informed of this policy during the booking process, and no mention of the 72 hour policy was made in the confirmation email I received from the hotel after I reserved the room. The reservation agent I spoke with explained to me that he had no authority to reverse this charge. When I asked to speak with a manager, he explained to me (this was Saturday morning) that no manager would be available to handle the matter until Monday at the earliest and that, because it was the weekend, he really shouldn't even be working. How could there be no manager on duty at the hotel? This reservation agent then proceeded to lecture me on the customs of cancellation policies and how I should have known better. How insulting! Three days after canceling my room and after repeated requests to have a manager call me, I have still not heard from a manager about reversing this charge and explaining the unprofessional behavior of the reservation agent. This hotel is poorly staffed with downright rude employees and absentee management. Be forewarned.

Reviews.Title: “Found a new hotel for family trips”
Reviews.Author: Rich C
Reviews.Content: The few reviews I read prior to our stay were pretty bad and I don't understand why. The staff was really nice and even went out of there way to accommodate my wife and I. Our room was very clean and the cleaning staff was on point for our room(super tidy). Our room itself had some really hip features like an Ipod dock station with built in wall speakers, a cool bathroom mirror with a t.v. inside of it and a state of the art shower with like 8 shower heads. No fridge :( but I heard there in the works. Location was very nice also! My wife and I were really impressed and will be staying there again in the near future. Keep up the good work Flatiron!!! P.s My son loved the fish tank in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “New hotel but gym not open, no room service”
Reviews.Author: markyd72
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September and still lots of new hotel issues: No room service No mini bar Gym not yet open Also, check in at 4pm and the jacuzzi baths in the rooms are half the size of a normal bath and so are pointless

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FAY J
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at a lot of different hotels in New York City but I must say the Flatiron was my favorite, I stayed at the flatiron hotel in September and I loved it the hotel is beautiful and very clean and in New York its hard to find a up to date clean hotel without the price being crazy but the Flatiron is affordable and the rooms are very nice and comfortable. The staff was great as well very helpful and really tried to help us with any questions we had. Steven the manager is great and he was always there when we needed him. Im going back to NYC in November and I didn’t hesitate to book with the Flatiron again it’s the only place I will stay when I go to NYC.. So if your looking for a nice clean affordable hotel in a great area, look no further the Flatiron is the place to be you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: hilary g
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent. A newly opened hotel, which still had some kinks to work out. Our room was very nice, but the bathroom had a couple issues. The staff was understanding and upgraded us to a beautiful suite. One thing that sticks in my head is the aroma...very fresh. :)

Reviews.Title: “Flatiron Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice for my three BFF's and I for our first trip to NYC. A very clean and comfortable hotel, and beautifully decorated. The lobby was open and surrounded with windows, and had a huge circular aquarium in the center that went up to the second floor. Gorgeous! The rooms were very pretty and clean. Nice shower, and a built in TV in the bathroom mirror! Cool! The staff were very quick to accomodate any of our requests. and, they were more than willing to assist us in making our weekend a fun one, not one wasted on trying to figure out where to go and how to get there. Lots of great tips, advice and assistance from the desk staff, and especially the general manager Steven. You were all great! I'd come back and stay at Flatiron again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing flat about the Flatiron Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Antonella C
Reviews.Content: I am one of the 3 peeps that stayed with Adelle and will 'ditto' her review since she took the words right out of my mouth lol!! It really was a fantastic hotel! and Steven, you are the best! First time in NYC with 3 of my gal peeps, and Flatiron made the experience even better. Hotel is ccc--Central, Clean, Crisp!!!! The aquarium is spectacular, and the corner lobby area make it for a wonderful people watch spot. A cross from classic (venetian plaster walls, italian marble etc.) to modern. Too cool, tv embedded in the bathroom mirror, a first for me to see. Staff was beyond helpful, and took time to understand what we wanted to do, and provide options accordingly. Our "foodie" G.M. was extremely knowledgeable, and made sure to get input and feedback from our stay. Your the best Steven!!! This hotel is a definite gem in the Big Apple!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip with the girls”
Reviews.Author: 615aim
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is just opening and working things out, I have to say it is a wonderful property. The views are spectacular I could see the empire states building. The rumble of the subway made me feel like hey I'm in the big city. Steve the manager was so kind and helpful I can't say enough good things about him. If you stay at this property you will hopefully get to meet him.

Reviews.Title: “first time in the big apple”
Reviews.Author: padcakes
Reviews.Content: Wonderful accomodating staff at front desk, Spotless clean great area

Reviews.Title: “Good place, not too touristy.”
Reviews.Author: PeteHeid
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel. I enjoyed the tv on the mirror.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy but impractical; beware the check-in time”
Reviews.Author: two_from_singapore
Reviews.Content: This is a newly reopened hotel under new management that is clearly trying hard to make an impression as a hip property. There were certainly some impressive touches. Like the flat TV screen magically embedded into the bathroom mirror. Overall, though, I would have preferred it if the hotel had splurged less on electronics and other special effects, and more on practicalities that travellers actually need. For example, I would have traded the TV in the bathroom for a fridge, especially since there is no restaurant in the hotel. Worst of all, the hotel has a 4pm check-in time, probably because it doesn't have enough cleaners to turn around the rooms fast enough. I arrived at around 3pm and had to step out anyway to meet a friend, so it did not inconvenience me much. But if you are arriving in the city in the morning, this hotel would be the wrong choice. You don't want to pay these sorts of rates for the privilege of having the hotel store your luggage while you wait hours for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra G
Reviews.Content: I was in New York with my 2 daughters on Oct. 1 and 2nd and stayed at the Flatiron Hotel. We were absolutely impressed with every aspect of this hotel. Very clean and well appointed rooms. Great size room (for New York). The beds were amazing, the best sleep I have had in a long time. Great location. I have a background in travel and have stayed in many hotels all over the world, the Flatiron by far exceeded our expectations in service, cleanliness, and decor. As indicated in other reviews the hotel is still in its soft opening stage and may be lacking in some of the service areas however, this did not affect us in any way because if you required anything, the staff was "on it' . The Hotel Manager - Steven Meyer - definately made our stay unforgetable! From the moment we arrived, Steven greeted us, spent time with us to provide us with information on sites, shopping, getting around, and even made dinner reservations for us. The hotel was very busy upon our arrival, check in was at 4 pm. I needed to have the room available for 3 pm. Steven took care of us immediately and ensured that we were comfortable, satisfied and had everything we needed. I can't say enough about our experience in New York. Having worked in the service industry for many years I can only say that good service is what keeps people coming back. I have to go back to New York in a few months and will definately be back at the Flatiron. Since my return 2 days ago, I have already recommended the Flatiron to a number of people travelling to New York in the next little while. I recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates good, beyond expectations service, a good night's sleep and a friendly environment. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did. Thank you Steven for taking such good care of me and my girls -- coco and daughters :)

Reviews.Title: “Serves it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: BruceBanner79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is still not "ready". There are no amenities available at this time. My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. Since we were in New York, we did not plan to spend much time in the hotel anyway, but it would've been nice to have a lounge. The hotel was clean and very up to date. The bathroom had a TV built in the mirror and the lighting and curtains were all controlled by a remote. The room was small, but very nice. The location was OK. It was one block away from Broadway but was 16 blocks from Times Square. Penn Station was 8 blocks so the Subway was within a good distance. Unfortunately I only have one photo because my wife's phone was lost on the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great”
Reviews.Author: tjs066
Reviews.Content: When some of the amenities (gym, lobby bar, mini-bars in room) are finished and the team is a little more polished, this will be a great spot. The hotel is nicely designed and quality of furnishings is good. The rooms are not huge, but comfortable. Also, the neighborhood is interesting, not "touristy". Staff should just be direct and honest about the missing amenities: we were told by two different staff members that the gym wasn't finished, but they had an "arrangement with a local gym". The arrangement was that anyone that was a resident of NYC got a free three-day trial. Not sure why a NYC resident would be staying at the hotel! The room rate was such that that the $30 fee for two-days at the gym was not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel with great potential”
Reviews.Author: bjs1987
Reviews.Content: This newly-remodeled hotel was in its "soft opening" phase when I stayed there, so some of my observations may not apply as the hotel gears up for full service. For example, I arrived late at night, tired and thirsty, only to discover there was no room service, no restaurant or bar, no minibar in the room, and no vending machines. I assume this will not be the case forever, but if this matters to you, check before you book! The room itself was quite spacious, with glorious high ceilings and warm Venetian plaster walls. Wonderfully comfortable queen bed. Coffee maker on the compact desk but no electrical outlets on it, or nearby, for recharging phone, iPad and laptop. Push-button controlled draperies but no full-length mirror. There was enough space for an armchair, but there was no armchair. (These last two are the kind of things I expect they are still working on. I hope.) The bathroom was small but had good counter space and lighting. And a TV screen in the mirror. The shower was very small but had an amazing array of shower heads--an overhead rainfall head, a hand spray, and six body jets. Took a bit of experimenting to figure out the controls on the shower, however. Staff were friendly and helpful, although I think they are still figuring things out. Location is terrific, close to subways, Flatiron district, Chelsea galleries and restaurants, Greeley Park, etc. Penn Station is walkable if you don't have a ton of luggage and the weather is good. I would stay here again, especially after they are fully up and running.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: mom2rk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over labor day weekend. We had the Toshi suite which is the corner room. I believe this is the largest room on each floor. The hote is small. There are only about 8 or 9 rooms on each floor. From the floorplan map near the elevator, it appears the corner room is the largest. The room overall was small. The room had lots of windows which gave a good view. From this room, you can get a side view of the Empire State buiding. We stayed on the 9th floor. The odd thing is, on the 9th floor, we can hear and feel the subway beneath. I found this very strange. You can basically tell when a subway was going thru. The hotel is new but somehow the rooms don't look or feel new. The bathroom was small. In general, everything felt claustraphobic. The AC in our room was not working well. It hums loudly all day but the temp in the room remained the same. The engr came to look at it on the 2nd night but couldn't get it fixed. We didn't sleep well during the entire stay. The kids did enjoy the awesome fish tank in the lobby. We would not return to this hotel. I found the hotel on Travelzoo and thought to give a try. Not a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!!”
Reviews.Author: aviatorvic
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NY. I took my 22 year old daughter and her two best friends and we planned to stay 4 days. After delays, cancellations, and a stay in another city, Delta finally got us to NY. We arrived tired and discouraged. The staff at this hotel was absolutely wonderful. They made sure we had the best room in the hotel, and helped us map out our activities to guarantee us covering as much as possible in our shortened stay. Our every request was met and our stay was so comfortable. The beds are heavenly, the rooms were spotless, and everything was decorated so beautifully! One evening we were in the lobby, getting ready to get a cab and head to Times Square for the evening. The Owner, Mr. Toshi was in the lobby, introduced himself to us, offered us champagne, and had a staff member get us a taxi. We had champagne and took pictures with him, it was the start to a fun filled evening. We will stay at this hotel again!
